article.description: Freshman Eric Eaves scored 26 points and South Carolina State beat Maryland-Eastern Shore 68-63 on Monday night for its fifth straight victory.
article.headline: Freshman Eric Eaves scores 26, SC State beats UMES 68-63
article.linkText: Freshman Eric Eaves scores 26, SC State beats UMES 68-63
article.story: ORANGEBURG, S.C. -- Freshman Eric Eaves scored 26 points and South Carolina State beat Maryland-Eastern Shore 68-63 on Monday night for its fifth straight victory. Eaves was 10-of-16 shooting and made all four of his free-throw attempts. Ty Soloman hit a 3-pointer to give SC State a 60-58 lead with 1:27 left and Eaves had a 3-point play for a five-point advantage with 57 seconds left. Devin Martin answered with a 3-pointer but Soloman made it a two-possession game again after a layup. After a UMES turnover, Ed Stephens hit two free throws to extend SC State's lead to 67-61 with 18.5 seconds left. Daryll Palmer had 10 points, five rebounds and four blocks for SC State (10-10, 5-1 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference), which had just 11 wins last season. Dominique Elliott led Maryland-Eastern Shore (4-16, 1-4) with 19 points, and Martin finished with 15.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
